targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "people" WHERE ("entity_id" = 'bulgaria_coronavirus_deaths') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT difference(last("confirmed")) FROM "data" WHERE ("region" =~ /^$region$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d) fill(null)
SELECT last("value") FROM "covid_current_rate"  GROUP BY time(1w)

panels.description: Shows time in days to double the cases
panels.title: Time to Double $region

panels.description: Shows cases for  the current or last day (if there is no data for today yet). Between 00:00 and 00:00 UTC.
panels.title: Last $region

targets.query: SELECT difference(last("value")) FROM "people" WHERE ("entity_id" = 'bulgaria_coronavirus_confirmed') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d) fill(null)
SELECT difference(last("value")) FROM "people" WHERE ("entity_id" = 'bulgaria_coronavirus_confirmed') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d) fill(null)

panels.description: Deaths per million people of the population
panels.title: Mortality per milion

panels.description: People tested for Covid-19 per 1 Mil people of region population
panels.title: Tested per million population

panels.description: People tested for one confirmed case
panels.title: One confirmed per tests

panels.description:
These are calculated eventual positive among the population based on how many tests are needed for one confirmed case. 

Use that with high caution,  it is based only on confirmed and  official tests numbers and does not include self serological tests! Real number is probably lower because most countries tests with priority contact cases and people with symptoms.
panels.title: Projected positives

panels.description: Total population of country or region
panels.title: Population

These are calculated eventual positive among the population based on how many tests are needed for one confirmed case. 

Use that with high caution,  it is based only on confirmed and  official tests numbers and does not include self serological tests! Real number is probably lower because most countries tests with priority contact cases and people with symptoms.

panels.description:
These are calculated eventual positive among the population based on how many tests are needed for one confirmed case. 

Use that with high caution,  it is based only on confirmed and  official tests numbers and does not include self serological tests! Real number is probably lower because most countries tests with priority contact cases and people with symptoms.
panels.title: Calculated eventual virus spread (use with high caution ! )

panels.content:
The data is pulled automatically from [John Hopkins repository](https://github.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19) before 30 Apr, after 30 Apr that data is pulled from [Wordometers](https://ahmednafies.github.io/covid/worldometers/) including number of tested. It updates on 10 min intervals and updates if there is a change. Growth factor is explained here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kas0tIxDvrg

[Backend calculations](https://github.com/nkitanov/influx_covid/tree/master/globals)

Contact: nkitanov@gmail.com
